content.description: Climb up an easy ramp, past a tree into an alcove. From there follow a short chimney straight up to a face. climb the featured slab up and right (this section is unprotected), past a cat claw bush, passing a roof on it’s left side to a fun slabby dihedral.  Follow this, taking the obvious path, to the anchors.
content.protection: Single set of gear to #3 and nuts.
content.location: Located on the right side of the crag.

content.description: Follow the obvious brown streak in the center of the crag.  The rock on this route is better than it first appears when looking at it.
content.location: Starts on the middle right side of the crack below a small boulder.

content.description: Climb a small easy boulder at the base of the route.  Then follow discontinuous thin vertical cracks past a bulge and shallow horizontal crack. From here either continue straight up the more challenging and rounded arete (fun but unprotected) , or step left a clip the final bolts for slip and slide.
content.protection: Small to medium nuts (work better than cams) and finger size cams.
content.location: On the right side of the main face of the crag.  Look for the thin vertical crack.

content.description: Ascend the small roof (easier on the right. Harder on the left directly below the bolts) and follow 4 bolts up a slab and passing a clump of bushes and cactus on it’s right side to the anchors.
content.location: 30 feet left of Slip n Slide and right of the cactus growing out of the rock

content.description: Slip and Slide is a small crag with a few long, moderate, climbs. It’s easy to top rope and can make for a fun warm down after climbing on the Thumb.  All 4 climbs share the same set of anchors.  The anchors are set back slightly and you might want to extend the master point if top roping at the crag.
